agenda_items.title: Oral Communications
agenda_items.summary: The commission did not receive any cards, and there were no phone calls on hold.

agenda_items.title: Recruitment and Examination Report
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented the regular recruitment and examination status report, representing current recruitments in process. The team is working on 36 open recruitments. The report identifies the division of work and pinpoints the various stages of the examination and selection process. Ms. Adams offered to answer any questions.

agenda_items.title: Eligible List Established
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented a report including all of the eligible lists that were recently established since the last meeting in May. The report includes the total number of applications and the number of individuals that advanced through the various stages of the examination processes. Since the last meeting, 12 lists were established. Seven were open to the public, four were given on a promotional basis, and one was given on an open and promotional basis. This item is for note and file; Ms. Adams offered to answer any questions.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Magrevian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Magrevian expressed appreciation for the city's efforts in finding six qualified candidates from 261 applications for an administrative assistant position. She noted the challenges of no-shows and candidates not passing, highlighting the effort involved in hiring. She commended the city for working hard on finding candidates, considering the high number of applicants. The Commissioner concluded that good job everyone was in order.

agenda_items.title: Formal Introduction of Commissioner Gihanian
agenda_items.summary: Chair Hatamian formally introduced Commissioner Gihanian to the Glendale Civil Service Commission. He highlighted Commissioner Gihanian's extensive experience in both the government and private sectors, briefly reviewing his resume. The Chair welcomed him to the commission and invited him to introduce himself to the audience.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Gihanian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Gihanian introduced himself as a 35-plus year resident of Glendale, where he and his wife are raising their three young boys. He is the Director of Global Government Affairs for Lam Research Corporation, a semiconductor equipment maker. He also serves as the Vice Chair of the LA County Small Business Commission. Previously, he worked on Capitol Hill for ten years, handling business policy, and at the US Chamber of Commerce doing the same. He expressed excitement about working with the commission.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian welcomed Commissioner Gihanian, noting the collaborative nature of the commission. He emphasized that the commission benefits from diverse viewpoints, even from those without a legal background. He also thanked Lucy Varpetian, counsel, for her ongoing assistance and expertise.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Magrevian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Magrevian welcomed Commissioner Gihanian and expressed looking forward to working with him.

agenda_items.title: Job Bulletin for Approval: Police Lieutenant
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented a police lieutenant job bulletin for approval, as required by Civil Service Rule 4, Section 3C for sworn promotional recruitments within the Police Department. The bulletin aligns with the existing Police Lieutenant class specification, with a few modifications requested by police management. A key addition is designating the Supervisory Leadership Institute (SLI) as a highly desirable qualification, although completion of SLI is not a requirement. Refinements were made to articulate the skills, knowledge, and abilities expected of this management-level position. The selection process includes an application evaluation, a professional panel interview with a tactical component, and a community internal panel interview. The job bulletin will be posted from June 30th through July 14th, 2025, with examinations tentatively scheduled for the week of August 18th, 2025. The eligible list will be valid for one year, consistent with Civil Service Rule 4, Section 17. The Glendale Management Association has reviewed the job bulletin and has not expressed any concerns. Ms. Adams respectfully recommended that the Commission approve the proposed job bulletin for Police Lieutenant as submitted. Representatives from HR and police management were present to answer questions.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Magrevian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Magrevian, drawing on her experience representing law enforcement, expressed approval of the additions to the job duties and the position. She found the bulletin aligned with what a Lieutenant does and is required to do.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Reen
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Reen inquired about the classification, asking if updates to the classification should be done at the same time, even though it's not on the agenda. He also asked how the members for the selection panel and the interview process are chosen.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Ms. Adams
commissioner_comments.comment: Ms. Adams clarified that while there is no need to change the class specification tonight, the city is undergoing a top-to-bottom review of all class specifications. She explained that the commission would likely see hundreds of updated class specifications over the next 12 months. In response to panel selections and the interview process, Ms. Adams explained that the HR Department works closely with the Chief of Police, and takes into consideration recommendations from the City Manager for members from the public. HR then makes sure that the invitees are available.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian requested clarification of the procedure for commission changes to class specifications and impact to the union agreement.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Ms. Adams
commissioner_comments.comment: Ms. Adams stated that they will only take information back to the unions if the recommendation edits are substantial. If the edits are grammatical, minor or clearly state essential functions the information will not be taken back to the unions. However if the changes were to impact requirements to compete, or to the design of the examination, they would then need to meet and confirm with the union again.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Commissioner Naravian
commissioner_comments.comment: Commissioner Naravian inquired whether all eligible candidates have access to the Supervisory Leadership Institute program that is highly desirable for this position.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Captain Robert Williams
commissioner_comments.comment: Captain Robert Williams from the Glendale Police Department stated that every sergeant after the one-year probation period is eligible to take the course, but is not mandatory.

agenda_items.title: Reports and Information: Employee Job Performance Evaluations Past Due Aging Report
agenda_items.summary: Ms. Adams presented an informational report on performance evaluation and the return status for the City of Glendale's employees. She indicated that the response rate is good and there are no evaluations on the second notice list. Ms. Adams offered to answer questions.

commissioner_comments.speaker: Chair Hatamian
commissioner_comments.comment: Chair Hatamian gave kudos to the city staff, noting the difficulty of achieving a zero past due status, especially in large organizations like the Sheriff's Department and Department of Mental Health. He commended the city's achievement as amazing.
